docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: STANDING, LIKE A CANDIDATE, BEHIND A podium in a restaurant in midtown Manhattan, George N. Gillett Jr. is addressing a roomful of travel industry representatives, pitching the attractions of the winter season at Vail, the Colorado ski resort he has owned since 1985. A diminutive, 50-year-old entrepreneur who made a fortune in the meatpacking business and another as the owner of television stations,

byline.original: By Jon Bowermaster; Jon Bowermaster, a freelance writer, is completing a book about the future of small towns in America
